reviews.review_msg: (FANX99, not EDUC211) Sheena was great! I initially didn't think I could pass the class at all because I'm that bad at math. But she is very caring, and genuinely wants you to do well. Don't be afraid to ask questions or for clarification, she won't get mad or impatient - she'll keep explaining until you understand. I'd recommend her 100%!!

I had her as my Fanx99 prof and she was really nice, and went out of her way to help and make her self accessible. You can tell she really cares about her students. I would take fanx99 with her if you can.

Sheena is one of the only profs at SFU in my experience that cared how you did in the class. If you show up, try, and reach out if things are uncertain then there is no reason for you to not succeed in the class. Would recommend for anyone, even someone who is not going into education.

Sheena was great and I really enjoyed this class. Many had the impression of it being a GPA booster and were disappointed. If you put in the effort to understand and do the work, you will do well because you earned it, not simply because it is an education class. Sheena cares about students and is absolutely fair.

Such a great prof! He is literally the most genuine and kind person ever!! I went into this class having no idea what I was going to learn so I was fairly weary about enrolling. I now can proudly say that I have no regrets! This was such an amazing course and I learned so much from him. He was very accommodating during the pandemic also.

A very nice professor. Never gives more than one assignment at a time. As a non-math student, sometimes the expectations of our abilities are not quite in check with reality. Test formats are odd, lots on the test that wasn't covered in class. Still an easy course for Q requirement.

Sean is honestly one of the best profs I've had at SFU. He made it easy to understand the concepts and mostly was looking for how much effort we put into the HWs. He also let us redo most of the HWs. I would not call the class an easy A, but it was not a hard class by any means if you put in the effort. Would take more classes with Sean.

Sean was a kind and sweet prof who was also pretty entertaining. His midterm was pretty hard but youll be fine if you keep up with the other weekly assignments. Overall, its not an easy A but its manageable.

Sean Is a fantastic Prof. He introduces idea methodically and makes them very digest-able. He is a tough marker but if you follow his guidelines and take his feedback seriously it is easy to do well. He is a bit of an odd fish but one of the good kind. Unintentionally really funny at times and real relaxed most of the time as well. One of the best.

Sean Chorney has shown wonderful 3 hour lectures every Friday. 3Hour lecture was not boring even it was Friday. Homework is very fair (about 5 question every week). All midterm and final is take home so it can be done without mistakes like other math class. The best professor I ever had.

Sean is an excellent teacher. I am horrible at math and had't done it since grade 11 but this is one of the best courses I have taken at SFU. He makes classes and content engaging and interesting. He is very patient and willing to help you learn in his office hours. I learned to conceptualize math in different ways and truly loved it.

Sean does his best to vary his teaching style throughout the course of a semester. He is always willing to help during his office hours, but sometimes is unable to explain how he reached answers.  Lectures are often vague, so read the textbook. Furthermore, I found a large disconnect between what was done in class and homework vs. exams.

Sean is a great teacher but his lectures and instructions can sometimes be a bit unclear. However he is always available for extra help outside of class and he truly made learning math a lot more fun than I would've expected. If you pay attention and work hard you can get a good grade.
